executable.title: Unbiased Non Local Means filter for DWI
executable.description: Filters a set of diffusion weighted images using Unbiased Non Local Means for Rician noise. It exploits not only the spatial redundancy, but the redundancy in similar gradient directions as well; it takes into account the N closest gradient directions to the direction being processed (a maximum of 5 gradient directions is allowed to keep a reasonable computational load, since we do not use neither similarity maps nor block-wise implementation). The noise parameter is automatically estimated. A complete description of the algorithm may be found in "DWI filtering using joint information for DTI and HARDI", by Antonio Tristan Vega and Santiago Aja-Fernandez (under review).
executable.contributor: Antonio Tristan Vega, Santiago Aja Fernandez. University of Valladolid (SPAIN). Partially founded by grant number TEC2007-67073/TCM from the Comision Interministerial de Ciencia y Tecnologia (Spain).

parameters.label: UNLM for DWI Noise Removal Parameters

integer-vector.name: iRadiusSearch
integer-vector.label: Search radius
integer-vector.description: The algorithm search for similar voxels in a neighborhood of this size (larger sizes than the default one are extremely slow).

integer-vector.name: iRadiusComp
integer-vector.label: Comparison radius
integer-vector.description: Similarity between blocks is measured using windows of this size.

float.name: iH
float.label: h parameter
float.description: This parameter is related to noise; the larger the parameter, the more agressive the filtering. Should be near 1, and only values between 0.8 and 1.2 are allowed

integer.name: iNumNeighbors
integer.label: Number of neighboring gradients
integer.description: The number of the closest gradients that are used to jointly filter a given gradient direction (a maximum of 5 is allowed).

integer-vector.name: iRadiusEstimation
integer-vector.label: Noise Estimation Radius
integer-vector.description: A neighborhood of this size is used to compute the statistics for noise estimation.
